TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit AxHost/ConnectionPointCookie extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Connects an ActiveX control to a client that handles the controlâ€™s events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ActiveX controls communicate with clients through their COM interface. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AxHost.ConnectionPointCookie> class provides the link between the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AxHost> class and the ActiveX control.
For more information, see "Events in COM and Connectable Objects" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

MemberSignature.Value: public ConnectionPointCookie (object source, object sink, Type eventInterface);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(object source, object sink, class System.Type eventInterface) cil managed

Docs.param: A connectable object that contains connection points.
The client's sink which receives outgoing calls from the connection point.
The outgoing interface whose connection point object is being requested.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AxHost.ConnectionPointCookie.%23ctor%2A> constructor establishes a connection between the ActiveX control and the client.

Docs.exception:
does not implement .

does not implement .
The connection point has already reached its limit of connections and cannot accept any more.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Disconnect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disconnects the ActiveX control from the client.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A>. Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.
For more information, see [Finalize Methods and Destructors](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70), [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md), and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).
